column1: KhamûlHe was the only Ringwraith whose name is revealed in the Legendarium. was one of the nine Nazgûl
column2: second only to the Witch-king himself. He was called Saurons lieutenant
column4: and "the Second Chief" or "the Black Easterling"

column1: File:Stephen Hickman - Gaffer Gamgee and the Black Rider.jpg
He was a king of Easterlings during the Second Age
column2: and he was one of the nine Men to whom Sauron gave Nine Rings. Like the others
column3: he became a powerful sorcerer and ruler until eventually faded into a Wraiths and his will was surrendered to Sauron. By  he was already one of Saurons servants.
Khamûl was most ready to perceive the presence of the One Ring
column4: but his power was most confused and diminished by daylight.

column1: In  Sauron returned to Mordor and declared openly to his enemies. Khamûl and two other Ringwraiths were sent to the fortress of Dol Guldur and Khamûl took command.
During the War of the Ring he was one of the Ringwraiths who entered the Shire
column2: and asked Gaffer Gamgee for "Baggins". However it was the day after Frodo Baggins had left Hobbiton
column3: and he then pursued the Hobbits to Bucklebury Ferry in the Shire some days later.

column1: Following the destruction of the One Ring
column2: Khamûl perished with the rest of the Ringwraiths.
